p: In Brazil, the reemergence of dengue epidemics occurred in 1980â€™s [ 13], when an outbreak of Dengue virus serotype 1 (DENV-1) and Dengue virus serotype 4 (DENV-4) was registered in Roraima state [ 14]. In 2010, DENV-4 was detected in the North of Brazil after more than 20 years without it being reported in the country. In the following years, this serotype disseminated to other Brazilian regions [ 15], triggering an epidemic with approximately 2 million cases in 2013.
